content:
I have installed both pandas and matplotlib using pip3 install. However, when I run my script that includes importing pandas and matplotlib and reading an Excel file using pandas' pd.ExcelFile() function, I encounter an ImportError stating "No module named 'xlrd'". Why is the necessary xlrd module missing? Here is my script and the error I receive:

Script:
```python
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
data = pd.ExcelFile("Obes-phys-acti-diet-eng-2014-tab.xls")
print (data.sheet_names)
```

Error:
```python
dhcp-169-233-172-97:Obesity juliushamilton$ python3 ob.py
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "ob.py", line 4, in <module>
    data = pd.ExcelFile("Obes-phys-acti-diet-eng-2014-tab.xls")
  File "/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.4/lib/python3.4/site-packages/pandas/io/excel.py", line 169, in __init__
    import xlrd  # throw an ImportError if we need to
ImportError: No module named 'xlrd'
```

The error you're encountering is due to the absence of the `xlrd` module, which is required by pandas to read Excel files in the `.xls` format. When you use `pd.ExcelFile()`, pandas relies on `xlrd` to handle `.xls` files.

To resolve this issue, you need to install the `xlrd` package. You can do this using pip. Open your terminal or command prompt and run the following command:

```bash
pip3 install xlrd
```

After installing `xlrd`, try running your script again. It should work without raising the ImportError.

Additionally, if you are working with `.xlsx` files in the future, you might want to consider using `openpyxl` or `pandas`' built-in `read_excel` function, which supports `.xlsx` files directly. You can install `openpyxl` with:

```bash
pip3 install openpyxl
```

For `.xls` files, `xlrd` is still the way to go. If you run into any further issues, make sure your Python environment and all packages are up-to-date.
